title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: safe to Utterbol: weary on it and all its ways!"  Said the sergeant:
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "That is an evil wish for one who shall do well at Utterbol.  But come,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: tarry not."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: So he brought Ralph to the Lord, who still sat in his chair beside that
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: fair woman, and Ralph did obeysance to him; yet he had a sidelong
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: glance also for that fair seeming-queen, and deemed her both
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: proud-looking, and so white-skinned, that she was a wonder, like the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: queen of the fays: and it was just this that he had noted of the Queen
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: as he stood before her earlier in the day when they first came into the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: vale; therefore he had no doubt of this damsel's queenship.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Now the Lord spake to him and said:  "Well, youngling, thou hast done
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: well, and better than thy behest:  and since ye have been playing at
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: sharps, I deem thou would'st not do ill in battle, if it came to that.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: So now I am like to make something other of thee than I was minded to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: at first:  for I deem that thou art good enough to be a man.  And if
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: thou wilt now ask a boon of me, if it be not over great, I will grant
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: it thee."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Ralph put one knee to the ground, and said:  "Great Lord, I thank thee:
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: but whereas I am in an alien land and seeking great things, I know of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: no gift which I may take for myself save leave to depart, which I deem
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: thou wilt not grant me.  Yet one thing thou mayst do for my asking if
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: thou wilt.  If thou be still angry with the carle whom I first
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: unhorsed, I pray thee pardon him his ill-luck."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "Ill-luck!" said the Lord, "Why, I saw him that he was downright afraid
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: of thee.  And if my men are to grow blenchers and soft-hearts what is
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: to do then?  But tell me, Otter, what is the name of this carle?" Said
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: is he in a fray?"  "Naught so ill, Lord," said Otter.  "This time, like
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the rest of us, he knew not this gear.  It were scarce good to miss him
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: at the next pinch.  It were enough if he had the thongs over his back a
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: few dozen times; it will not be the first day of such cheer to him."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "Ha!" said the Lord, "and what for, Otter, what for?" "Because he was
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: somewhat rough-handed, Lord," said Otter.  "Then shall we need him and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: use him some day.  Let him go scot free and do better another bout.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: There is thy boon granted for thee, knight; and another day thou mayst
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: ask something more.  And now shall David have a care of thee.  And when
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: we come to Utterbol we shall see what is to be done with thee."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Then Ralph rose up and thanked him, and David came forward, and led him
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: to his tent.  And he was wheedling in his ways to him, as if Ralph were
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: now become one who might do him great good if so his will were.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: But the Lord went back again into the Tower.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: As to the Lady, she abode in her pavilion amidst many fears and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: desires, till Agatha entered and said:  "My Lady, so far all has gone
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: happily." Said the Lady:  "I deemed from the noise and the cry that he
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: was doing well.  But tell me, how did he?"  "My Lady," quoth Agatha,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "he knocked our folk about well-favouredly, and seemed to think little
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: of it."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "And Joyce," said the Lady, "how did she?"  "She looked a queen, every
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: inch of her, and she is tall," said Agatha:  "soothly some folk stared
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: on her, but not many knew of her, since she is but new into our house.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Though it is a matter of course that all save our new-come knight knew
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: that it was not thou that sat there.  And my Lord was well-pleased, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: now he hath taken her by the hand and led her into the Tower."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: The Lady reddened and scowled, and said:  "And he... did he come anigh
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: her?" "O yea," said Agatha, "whereas he stood before my Lord a good
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: while, and then kneeled to him to pray pardon for one of our men who
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: had done ill in the tilting:  yea, he was nigh enough to her to touch
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: her had he dared, and to smell the fragrance of her raiment.  And he
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: seemed to think it good to look out of the corners of his eyes at her;
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: though I do not say that she smiled on him." The Lady sprang up, her
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: cheeks burning, and walked about angrily a while, striving for words,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: till at last she said:  "When we come home to Utterbol, my lord will
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: see his new thrall again, and will care for Joyce no whit: then will I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: have my will of her; and she shall learn, she, whether I am verily the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: least of women at Utterbol!  Ha! what sayest thou?  Now why wilt thou
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: stand and smile on me?--Yea, I know what is in thy thought; and in very
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: sooth it is good that the dear youngling hath not seen this new thrall,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: this Ursula.  Forsooth, I tell thee that if I durst have her in my
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: that pair of beads about her neck."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "Now, our Lady," said Agatha, "thou art marring the fairness of thy
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: face again.  I bid thee be at peace, for all shall be well, and other
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: than thou deemest.  Tell me, then, didst thou get our Lord to swear
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: immunity for me?"  Said the Lady: "Yea, he swore on the edge of the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: other should lay hand on thee."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "Good," said Agatha; "then will I go to him to-morrow morning, when
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Joyce has gone from him.  But now hold up thine heart, and keep close
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: for these two days that we shall yet abide in Tower Dale: and trust me
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and grow, and shall one day rejoice thine heart."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

text: On the morrow Ralph wandered about the Dale where he would, and none
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: meddled with him.  And as he walked east along the stream where the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: valley began to narrow, he saw a man sitting on the bank fishing with
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: an angle, and when he drew near, the man turned about, and saw him.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Then he lays down his angling rod and rises to his feet, and stands
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: facing Ralph, looking sheepish, with his hands hanging down by his
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: sides; and Ralph, who was thinking of other folk, wondered what he
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: would.  So he said:  "Hail, good fellow!  What wouldst thou?"  Said the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: man: "I would thank thee."  "What for?" said Ralph, but as he looked on
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: him he saw that it was Redhead, whose pardon he had won of the Lord
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: yesterday; so he held out his hand, and took Redhead's, and smiled
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: friendly on him.  Redhead looked him full in the face, and though he
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: was both big and very rough-looking, he had not altogether the look of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: a rascal.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: He said:  "Fair lord, I would that I might do something for thine
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: avail, and perchance I may:  but it is hard to do good deeds in Hell,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: especially for one of its devils."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "Yea, is it so bad as that?" said Ralph.  "For thee not yet," said
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Redhead, "but it may come to it.  Hearken, lord, there is none anigh us
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: that I can see, so I will say a word to thee at once.  Later on it may
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: be over late: Go thou not to Utterbol whatever may betide."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "Yea," said Ralph, "but how if I be taken thither?"  Quoth Redhead: "I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: can see this, that thou art so favoured that thou mayst go whither thou
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: wilt about the camp with none to hinder thee.  Therefore it will be
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: easy for thee to depart by night and cloud, or in the grey of morning,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: when thou comest to a good pass, whereof I will tell thee.  And still I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: say, go thou not to Utterbol: for thou art over good to be made a devil
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: of, like to us, and therefore thou shalt be tormented till thy life is
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: spoilt, and by that road shalt thou be sent to heaven."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "But thou saidst even now," said Ralph, "that I was high in the Lord's
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: grace."  "Yea," said Redhead, "that may last till thou hast command to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: do some dastard's deed and nay-sayest it, as thou wilt: and then
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: farewell to thee; for I know what my Lord meaneth for thee." "Yea,"
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: said Ralph, "and what is that?"  Said Redhead; "He hath bought thee to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: give to his wife for a toy and a minion, and if she like thee, it will
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: be well for a while:  but on the first occasion that serveth him, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: she wearieth of thee (for she is a woman like a weather-cock), he will
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: lay hand on thee and take the manhood from thee, and let thee drift
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: about Utterbol a mock for all men.  For already at heart he hateth
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: thee."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Ralph stood pondering this word, for somehow it chimed in with the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: thought already in his heart.  Yet how should he not go to Utterbol
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: with the Damsel abiding deliverance of him there: and yet again, if
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: they met there and were espied on, would not that ruin everything for
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: time." "How then," said Ralph, "hath not the Lord good will toward me?"
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: use thee not for the pleasuring of his wife (so long as her pleasure in
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: betwixt Utterbol and Goldburg, and Utterbol and the mountains, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: wilderness, and scarcely there either, where he may not lay hand on
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

author: Morris, William

text: thereabout."

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: in this quest."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

text: "Yea," said Ralph, "and I wish thee well therein." Said Redhead,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: stammering somewhat; "It is even that woman of the Queen's whereof I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: told thee.  And now one last word, since I must not be over long in thy
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: tent, lest some one come upon us.  But, fair sir, if thy mind misgive
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: doubted that the damsel whom thou seekest hath been there, it is not
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: all so sure that thou wouldst have found her there.  For of late, what
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: with my Lord and my Lady being both away, the place hath been scant of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: folk; and not only is the said damsel wise and wary, but there be
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: others who have seen her besides my Lord, and who so hath seen her is
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: like to love her; and such is she, that whoso loveth her is like to do
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: land.  Now one more word yet; when I come to Utterbol, if thy damsel be
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: from the wild man: now I swear it by thy mouth, that if thou go to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

text: Said Ralph:  "Yea, but what is her case as now? tell me."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Quoth Agatha:  "She is in no such evil case; for my lady hateth her not
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: as yet, or but little; and, which is far more, my lord loveth her after
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: his fashion, and withal as I deem feareth her; for though she hath
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: utterly gainsaid his desire, he hath scarce so much as threatened her.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: A thing unheard of.  Had it been another woman she had by this time
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: known all the bitterness that leadeth unto death at Utterbol." Ralph
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: paled and he scowled on her, then he said: "And how knowest thou all
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the privity of the Lord of Utterbol?  who telleth thee of all this?"
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: She smiled and spake daintily: "Many folk tell me that which I would
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: know; and that is because whiles I conquer the tidings with my wits,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and whiles buy it with my body.  Anyhow what I tell thee is the very
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: sooth concerning this damsel, and this it is: that whereas she is but
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: in peril, she shall be in deadly peril, yea and that instant, if thou
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: go to Utterbol, thou, who art her lover..." "Nay," said Ralph angrily,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "I am not her lover, I am but her well-willer." "Well," quoth Agatha
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: looking down and knitting her brows, "when thy good will towards her
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: has become known, then shall she be thrown at once into the pit of my
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: lord's cruelty.  Yea, to speak sooth, even as it is, for thy sake (for
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: her I heed naught) I would that the lord might find her gone when he
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: cometh back to Utterbol."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "Yea," said Ralph, reddening, "and is there any hope for her getting
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: clear off?"  "So I deem," said Agatha.  She was silent awhile and then
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: spake in a low voice: "It is said that each man that seeth her loveth
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: her; yea, and will befriend her, even though she consent not to his
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: desire.  Maybe she hath fled from Utterbol."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Ralph stood silent awhile with a troubled face; and then he said: "Yet
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: thou hast not told me the why and wherefore of this play of thine, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the beguiling me into fleeing from the camp.  Tell it me that I may
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: pardon thee and pass on."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: She said:  "By thine eyes I swear that this is sooth, and that there is
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: naught else in it than this:  My lady set her love, when first she set
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: her eyes upon thee--as forsooth all women must: as for me, I had not
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: seen thee (though I told my lady that I had) till within this hour that
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: we met in the wood."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: She sighed therewith, and with her right hand played with the rent
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: raiment about her bosom.  Then she said: "She deemed that if thou
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: camest a mere thrall to Utterbol, though she might command thy body,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: yet she would not gain thy love; but that if perchance thou mightest
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: see her in hard need, and evilly mishandled, and mightest deliver her,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: there might at least grow up pity in thee for her, and that love might
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: come thereof, as oft hath happed aforetime; for my lady is a fair
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: woman.  Therefore I, who am my lady's servant and thrall, and who, I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: bid thee remember, had not seen thee, took upon me to make this
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: adventure, like to a minstrel's tale done in the flesh.  Also I spake
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: to my lord and told him thereof; and though he jeered at my lady to me,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: he was content, because he would have her set her heart on thee
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: utterly; since he feared her jealousy, and would fain be delivered of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: it, lest she should play some turn to his newly beloved damsel and do
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: her a mischief.  Therefore did he set thee free (in words) meaning,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: when he had thee safe at Utterbol again (as he nowise doubted to have
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: thee) to do as he would with thee, according as occasion might serve.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: For at heart he hateth thee, as I could see well.  So a little before
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: thou didst leave the camp, we, the Queen and I, went privily into a
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: place of the woods but a little way hence.  There I disarrayed both my
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: lady and myself so far as was needful for the playing out the play
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: which was to have seemed to thee a real adventure.  Then came I to thee
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: as if by chance hap, that I might bring thee to her; and if thou hadst
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: come, we had a story for thee, whereby thou mightest not for very
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: knighthood forbear to succour her and bring her whither she would,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: which in the long run had been Utterbol, but for the present time was
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: to have been a certain strong-house appertaining to Utterbol, and nigh
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: unto it.  This is all the tale, and now if thou wilt, thou mayst pardon
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: me; or if thou wilt, thou mayst draw out thy sword and smite off my
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: head.  And forsooth I deem that were the better deed."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: him beseechingly.  His face darkened as he beheld her thus, but it
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: rather than love thereafter."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: then, and would belike have let thee alone to fall into the hands of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: thy trust in this, that here and with me thou art even now nigher to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: would have it so.  He rose at once, and looked about for his fellow,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: but saw her not, and for some moments of time he thought he had but
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: dreamed of her; but he saw that the fire had been quickened from its
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: embers, and close by lay the hauberk and strange-fashioned helm, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the sword of the damsel, and presently he saw her coming through the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: trees barefoot, with the green-sleeved silken surcoat hanging below the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: knees and her hair floating loose about her.  She stepped lightly up to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Ralph with a cheerful smiling countenance and a ruddy colour in her
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: cheeks, but her eyes moist as if she could scarce keep back the tears
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: for joy of the morning's meeting.  He thought her fairer than erst, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: from him, blushing yet more.  Then she said in her sweet clear voice:
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: yonder, and have found a bright woodland pool, to wash the night off
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: me, and if thou wilt do in likewise and come back to me, I will dight
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: our breakfast meantime, and will we speedily to the road."  He did as
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: she bade him, thinking of her all the while till he came back to her
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: fresh and gay.  Then he looked to their horses and gave them fodder
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: gathered from the pool-side, and so turned to Ursula and found her with
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the meat ready dight; so they ate and were glad.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: When they had broken their fast Ralph went to saddle the horses, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: coming back found Ursula binding up her long hair, and she smiled on
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: him and said: "Now we are for the road I must be an armed knight again:
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: forsooth I unbound my hair e'en now and let my surcoat hang loose about
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: me in token that thou wottest my secret.  Soothly, my friend, it irks
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: me that now we have met after a long while, I must needs be clad thus
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: graceless.  But need drave me to it, and withal the occasion that was
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: given to me to steal this gay armour from a lad at Utterbol, the nephew
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: of the lord; who like his eme was half my lover, half my tyrant.  Of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: all which I will tell thee hereafter, and what wise I must needs steer
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: betwixt stripes and kisses these last days.  But now let us arm and to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: horse.  Yet first lo you, here are some tools that in thine hands shall
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: keep us from sheer famine: as for me I am no archer; and forsooth no
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: man-at-arms save in seeming."

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: he took well pleased.  So then they armed each the other, and as she
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: my arms and legs."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: grey mail, and said:  "That is well, dear friend, for since my breast
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: is a shield for thee it behoves it to be well covered." She looked at
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

text: So they mounted and went their ways through a close pine-wood, where
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the ground was covered with the pine-tree needles, and all was still
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: to the Sage of Swevenham.  Hast thou seen a water yesterday?"  "Yea,"
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "O," she said, "it is for pleasure, and a thought that I had: for a
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: while ago I was a thrall, living amongst fears that sickened the heart;
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and then a little while I was a lonely wanderer, and now...Therefore I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: was thinking that if ever I come back to mine own land and my home, the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: scent of a pine-wood shall make me happy."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: he spoke:  "Tell me, friend," said he, "if we be met by strong-thieves
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: on the way, what shall we do then?"
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: but slowly and in a dull and stern voice:  "Maybe it were good that
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "After I had stood in the thrall-market at Cheaping Knowe, and not been
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: sold, the wild man led me away toward the mountains that are above
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Goldburg; and as we drew near to them on a day, he said to me that he
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: was glad to the heart-root that none had cheapened me at the said
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: market; and when I asked him wherefore, he fell a weeping as he rode
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: beside me, and said: 'Yet would God that I had never taken thee.'  I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: asked what ailed him, though indeed I deemed that I knew.  He said:
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: 'This aileth me, that though thou art not of the blood wherein I am
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: bound to wed, I love thee sorely, and would have thee to wife; and now
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: I deem that thou wilt not love me again.'  I said that he guessed
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: aright, but that if he would do friendly with me, I would be no less
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: love but one man alone.  'Is he alive?' said he.  'Goodsooth, I hope
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: so,' said I, 'but if he be dead, then is desire of men dead within me.'
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: thou wottest, I had need to go forward, and no need to go back.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "Thus we entered into the mountains of Goldburg; but one morning, when
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: he arose, he was heavier of mood than his wont, and was restless
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: withal, and could be steadfast neither in staying nor going, nor aught
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: else.  So I asked what ailed him, and he said: 'My end draweth nigh; I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: have seen my fetch, and am fey.  My grave abideth me in these
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: mountains.'  'Thou hast been dreaming ugly dreams,' said I, 'such
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: him.  He changed not his mood for all that; but said:  'This is ill for
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Spake the first man again, and his voice quavered yet more: "Nay nay,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: stones!  And the fire, here this minute, there the next.  O Otter, this
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: dealing with a shackled man.  Well, for my part if those others have
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: sunk into the earth, or gone up into the air, they are welcome to their
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: wizardry, and I am glad of it.  For I know not how I should have done
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: to have seen my mate that out-tilted me made a gelded wretch of; and it
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: tormentors, though forsooth I have oft seen such sights.  Well, it is
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

text: his Nephew."

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

author: Morris, William

text: Now as they stood and beheld it, the Sage spake: "Lo ye, my children,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the castle and its outwork, and its dyke that wardeth the land of the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Well at the World's End.  Now from to-morrow, when we enter into the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: now save for the Book, and for me, who read it unto you.  Now ye would
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: not turn back were I to bid you, and I will not bid you.  Yet since the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: journey shall be yet with grievous toil and much peril, and shall try
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: and ling, they had firing enough, and supped off this venison of the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: rocks.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: So passed that day and two days more, and naught befell, save that on
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the midnight of the first day of their wending the rock-sea, Ralph
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: awoke and saw the sky all ablaze with other light than that of the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: moon; so he arose and went hastily to the Sage, and took him by the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: shoulder, and bid him awake; "For meseems the sky is afire, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: perchance the foe is upon us."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: The Sage awoke and opened his eyes, and rose on his elbow and looked
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: around sleepily; then he said laughing:  "It is naught, fair lord, thou
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: mayst lie down and sleep out the remnant of the night, and thou also,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: maiden:  this is but an earth-fire breaking out on the flank of the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: mountains; it may be far away hence.  Now ye see that he may not scale
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the rocks about us here without toil; but to-morrow night we may climb
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: up somewhere and look on what is toward."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: So Ralph lay down and Ursula also, but Ralph lay long awake watching
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the light above him, which grew fiercer and redder in the hours betwixt
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: moonset and daybreak, when he fell asleep, and woke not again till the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: sun was high.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: But on the next day as they went, the aspect of the rock-sea about them
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: changed:  for the rocks were not so smooth and shining and orderly, but
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: rose up in confused heaps all clotted together by the burning, like to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: clinkers out of some monstrous forge of the earth-giants, so that their
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: way was naught so clear as it had been, but was rather a maze of jagged
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: stone.  But the Sage led through it all unfumbling, and moreover now
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and again they came on that carven token of the sword and the bough.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Night fell, and as it grew dark they saw the glaring of the earth-fires
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: again; and when they were rested, and had done their meat, the Sage
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: said: "Come now with me, for hard by is there a place as it were a
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: stair that goeth to the top of a great rock, let us climb it and look
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: about us."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: So did they, and the head of the rock was higher than the main face of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the rock-sea, so that they could see afar.  Thence they looked north
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and beheld afar off a very pillar of fire rising up from a ness of the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: mountain wall, and seeming as if it bore up a black roof of smoke; and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the huge wall gleamed grey, because of its light, and it cast a ray of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: light across the rock-sea as the moon doth over the waters of the deep:
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: withal there was the noise as of thunder in the air, but afar off:
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: which thunder indeed they had heard oft, as they rode through the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: afternoon and evening.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Spake the Sage:  "It is far away:  yet if the wind were not blowing
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: from us, we had smelt the smoke, and the sky had been darkened by it.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Now it is naught so far from Utterbol, and it will be for a token to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: them there.  For that ness is called the Candle of the Giants, and men
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: deem that the kindling thereof forebodeth ill to the lord who sitteth
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: on the throne in the red hall of Utterbol."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Ralph laid his hand on Ursula's shoulder and said: "May the Sage's saw
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: be sooth!"
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: She put her hand upon the hand and said:  "Three months ago I lay on my
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: bed at Bourton Abbas, and all the while here was this huge manless
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: waste lying under the bare heavens and threatened by the storehouse of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the fires of the earth: and I had not seen it, nor thee either, O
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: friend; and now it hath become a part of me for ever."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Then was Ralph exceeding glad of her words, and the Sage laughed
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: inwardly when he beheld them thus.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: So they came adown from the rock and lay down presently under the fiery
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: heavens:  and their souls were comforted by the sound of the horses
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: cropping the grass so close to their ears, that it broke the voice of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the earth-fires' thunder, that ever and anon rolled over the grey sea
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: amidst which they lay.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: On the morrow they still rode the lava like to clinkers, and it rose
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: higher about them, till suddenly nigh sunset it ended at a turn of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: their winding road, and naught lay betwixt them and that mighty ness of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the mountains, save a wide grassy plain, here and there swelling into
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: low wide risings not to be called hills, and besprinkled with copses of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: bushes, and with trees neither great nor high.  Then spake the Sage:
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "Here now will we rest, and by my will to-morrow also, that your beasts
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: may graze their fill of the sweet grass of these unwarded meadows.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: which feedeth many a herd unowned of man, albeit they pay a quit-rent
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: to wild things that be mightier than they.  And now, children, we have
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: passed over the mighty river that once ran molten betwixt these
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: mountains and the hills yonder to the west, which we trod the other
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: day; yet once more, if your hearts fail you, there is yet time to turn
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: back; and no harm shall befall you, but I will be your fellow all the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: way home to Swevenham if ye will.  But if ye still crave the water of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the Well at the World's End, I will lead you over this green plain, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: then go back home to mine hermitage, and abide there till ye come to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: me, or I die."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Ralph smiled and said:  "Master, no such sorry story shall I bear back
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: to Upmeads, that after many sorrows borne, and perils overcome, I came
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: to the Gates of the Mountains, and turned back for fear of that which I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: had not proved."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: So spake he; but Ursula laughed and said:  "Yea, then should I deem thy
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: friendship light if thou leftest me alone and unholpen in the uttermost
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: wilderness; and thy manhood light to turn back from that which did not
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: make a woman afraid."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Then the Sage looked kindly on them and said:  "Yea, then is the last
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: word spoken, and the world may yet grow merrier to me.  Look you, some
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: there be who may abuse the gifts of the Well for evil errands, and some
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: who may use it for good deeds; but I am one who hath not dared to use
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: it lest I should abuse it, I being alone amongst weaklings and fools:
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: but now if ye come back, who knows but that I may fear no longer, but
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: use my life, and grow to be a mighty man.  Come now, let us dight our
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: supper, and kindle as big a fire as we lightly may; since there is many
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: a prowling beast about, as bear and lynx and lion; for they haunt this
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: edge of the rock-sea whereto the harts and the wild bulls and the goats
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: resort for the sweet grass, and the water that floweth forth from the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: lava."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: So they cut good store of firing, whereas there was a plenty of bushes
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: growing in the clefts of the rocks, and they made a big fire and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: tethered their horses anigh it when they lay down to rest; and in the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: night they heard the roaring of wild things round about them, and more
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: than once or twice, awakening before day, they saw the shape of some
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: terrible creature by the light of the moon mingled with the glare of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the earth-fires, but none of these meddled with them, and naught befell
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: them save the coming of the new day.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
