title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: aid from their own folk from the lands of Higham; wherefore they made a
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: mock of the defence of the Upmeads' men; and said that since, when they
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: were all joined together in Upmeads, they might enter where they would
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: now; nor would they burn either the High House or the other steadings,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: since, said they, they were minded to keep them sound and whole for
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: their own.

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: These tidings seemed good to Ralph; so he took a cup of wine and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: pledged the company, and said:  "My masters, such of you as list to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: all his life long."

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: went their ways.  Then Ralph bade Clement come with him that he might
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: knew of the muster, and of the order of departing on the morrow; and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: As they were on the way Ralph asked Clement what ailed his gossip
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Katherine that she had not come to meet him already; and Clement
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: laughed and said:  "Nought, nought; she is somewhat shamefaced to meet
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: thee first amongst a many folk, and she not able belike to refrain her
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: kisses and caresses to thee.  Fear not, she is in her bower-aloft, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: we shall find her there when we come back from our errand; fear not!
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: she will not sleep till she hath had her arms about thee." "Good is
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: apart from folk, something we shall be able to say to each other, which
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: belike neither she nor I had liked to leave unsaid till we meet again."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: So came they to the chief quarters of the fighting men, and Ralph had
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: all the leaders called to him, and he spake to them of how they should
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: war.  Withal they saw of him that he had no doubt but that they should
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and feared not what should befall.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: ways home to Clement's house again.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: They saw lights in the chamber or ever they entered, and when they came
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: to the door, lo! there within was Katherine walking up and down the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: floor as if she knew not how to contain herself.  She turned and saw
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Ralph at the door, and she cried aloud and ran towards him with arms
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: outspread.  But when she drew nigh to him and beheld him closely, she
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: withheld her, and falling down on her knees before him took his hand
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and fell to kissing it and weeping and crying out, "O my lord, my lord,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: her up, and embraced her and kissed her on the cheeks and the mouth,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and led her to the settle and sat down beside her and put his arm about
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: her; and Clement looked on smiling, and sat him down over against them.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Then spake Katherine:  "O my lord! how great and masterful hast thou
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: grown; never did I hope to see thee come back so mighty a man." And
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: again she wept for joy; but Ralph kissed her again, and she said,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: laughing through her tears:  "Master Clement, this lord and warrior
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: hath brought back with him something that I have not seen; and belike
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: he hath had one fair woman in his arms, or more it may be, since I saw
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: him last.  For though he but kisses me as his gossip and foster-mother,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: yet are his kisses closer and kinder than they were aforetime."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: told her somewhat of thy journeys, so far as I knew of them."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: thereof now?"

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: pity thereat.

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: But when he was done and he had sat beholding her, and saw how goodly a
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: woman she was, and how straight and well knit of body, he said:
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "Gossip, I wonder now, if thou also hast drunk of the Well; for thou
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: have led me to the Well at the World's End?  For as I said e'en now, I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: "Fair sir," said Clement, "as for her drinking of the Well at the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: World's End, it is not so; but this is a good woman, and a valiant, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Katherine cast friendly looks on them and said:  "Gossip, and thou,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Clement, I will make a clean breast of it once for all.  In the days
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: when I was first wedded to Master Clement yonder, he found his bed cold
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: without me, for he was a hot lover; therefore would he often have me
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: with him on his journeys, how hard soever or perilous the way might be.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Yea, Clement, thou lookest the sooth, though thou sayest it not, I was
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: nought loth thereto, partly because I would not grieve thee, my man;
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: but partly, and belike mostly, because I was wishful to see the ways of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the world even at the risk of being thrust out of the world.  So it
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: befell us on a time to make a journey together, a journey exceeding
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: long, in the company of certain chapmen, whereof some, and not a few,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: died on the way.  But we lived, and came into the eastern parts of the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: earth to a city right ancient, and fulfilled of marvels, which hight
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Sarras the Holy.  There saw we wonders whereof were it overlong to tell
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: of here; but one while I will tell thee, my lord.  But this I must
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: needs say, that I heard tell of a woman dwelling there, who was not old
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: by seeming, but had in her the wisdom of ten lives, and the longing gat
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: hold of me to see her and learn wisdom of her.  So I entreated many who
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: were called wise, some with prayers, and some with gifts also, to help
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: me to speech of her; but I gat nothing either by praying or giving;
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: they that would have helped me could not, and they that could would
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: not.  So, what between one thing and another, the longing to see the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Wise Woman grew as it were into a madness in me.  Amidst of which we
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: fell in with a merchant exceeding wise in ancient lore, who looked at
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: me (though Clement knew it not) with eyes of love.  Of this man I asked
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: concerning the Wise Woman, and he seeing my desire, strove to use it
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: merchant-like, and would deal with me and have in payment for his
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: learning a gift which I had nought to do to give.  Howbeit madness and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: my desire for speech with the Wise Woman got the better of me, and I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: promised to give no less than he would, trusting to beguile him after I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: had got my desire, and be quit of him.  So he led me to the woman and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: went his ways.  She dwelt all by herself in a nook of an ancient ruined
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: palace, erst the house of the ancientest of all the kings of Sarras.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: When I came to her, I saw nought dreadful or ugsome about her: she was
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: cheerful of countenance and courteous of demeanour, and greeted me
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: kindly as one neighbour in the street of Wulstead might do to another.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: I saw her, that she was by seeming a woman of some forty winters, trim
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and well-fashioned of body, nowise big, but slender, of dark red hair
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and brown eyes somewhat small.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "Now, she said to me, 'I have looked for thee a while; now thou art
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: come, thou shalt tell me what thou needest, and thy needs will I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: fulfil.  Yet needs must thou do a thing for me in return, and maybe
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: thou wilt deem it a great thing.  Yet whereas thou has struck a bargain
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: before thou camest hither, if I undo that for thee, the bargain with me
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: may be nought so burdensome.  How sayest thou?'
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: days had Clement come to know that I had done amiss; for he was a
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: jealous lover, and a violent man."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: no trap, if I were eager before, I was over-eager now; so when she bade
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: me swear to do her will, I swore it without tarrying.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

text: "Therewith she put her hand to her neck, and took thence the self-same
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: pair of beads which I gave to thee, dear gossip, and which (praise be
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: to All Hallows!) thou hast borne ever since; and she said:  'Now
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: hearken!  Thou shalt take this pair of beads, and do with them as I bid
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: thee.  Swear again thereto.'  So I swore by All Angels; and she said
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: again: 'This pair of beads shall one day lead a man unto the Well at
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the World's End, but no woman; forsooth, if a woman have them of a
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: woman, or the like of them, (for there be others,) they may serve her
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: for a token; but will be no talisman or leading-stone to her; and this
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: I tell thee lest thou seek to the Well on the strength of them.  For I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: bid thee give them to a man that thou lovest--that thou lovest well,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: when he is in most need; only he shall not be of thine own blood.  This
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: is all that I lay upon thee; and if thou do it, thou shalt thrive, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: if thou do it not, thou shalt come to harm.  And I will tell thee now
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: that this meeting betwixt us is not by chance-hap, but of my bringing
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: about; for I have laboured to draw thee to me, knowing that thou alone
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: of women would avail me herein.  Now shalt thou go home to thine
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: hostel, and take this for a token of my sooth-saying. The wise merchant
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: who led thee unto me is abiding thine homecoming that he may have of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: thee that which thou promisedst to him.  If then thou find him at thine
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: hostel, and he take thee by the hand and lead thee to bed, whereas
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Clement is away till to-morrow even, then shalt thou call me a vain
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: word-spinner and a liar; but if when thou comest home there, the folk
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: there say to thee merchant Valerius is ridden away hastily, being
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: called afar on a message of life and death, then shalt thou trow in me
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: as a wise woman.  Herewith depart, and I bid thee farewell.'
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

text: "So I went my ways to my hostel trembling, and at the door I met the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: hither my father and mother, as I promised to do after the battle.  In
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: good sooth, I deemed it would have lasted longer."  Said Ursula: "Dear
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: speedily, that thou mayst be back the sooner; for sorely do I long to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: enter thine house, beloved."  Then Ralph turned to Nicholas, and said:
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "Our host is not so great but that thou mayst victual it well; yet I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

text: battles: of thy Shepherds and the other footmen is not one slain, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: but some five hurt.  The Champions have lost three men slain outright,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and some fifteen hurt; of whom is thy brother Hugh, but not sorely."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

author: Morris, William

text: Short was the road back again to Wulstead, and whereas the day was not
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: very old when Ralph came there, he failed not to stop at Clement's
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: house, and came into the chamber where sat Dame Katherine in pensive
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: wise nigh to the window, with her open hands in her lap.  Quoth Ralph:
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "Rejoice, gossip! for neither is Clement hurt, nor I, and all is done
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: that should be done."  She moved her but little, but the tears came
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: into her eyes and rolled down her cheeks.  "What, gossip?" quoth Ralph;
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "these be scarce tears of joy; what aileth thee?"  "Nay," said
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Katherine, "indeed I am joyful of thy tidings, though sooth to say I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: looked for none other.  But, dear lord and gossip, forgive me my tears
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: on the day of thy triumph; for if they be not wholly of joy, so also
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: are they not wholly of sorrow.  But love and the passing of the days
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: are bittersweet within my heart to-day. Later on thou shalt see few
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: faces more cheerful and merry in the hall at Upmeads than this of thy
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: gossip's. So be merry now, and go fetch thy father and thy mother, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: rejoice their hearts that thou hast been even better than thy word to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: them.  Farewell, gossip; but look to see me at Upmeads before many days
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: are past; for I know thee what thou art; and that the days will
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: presently find deeds for thee, and thou wilt be riding into peril, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: coming safe from out of it.  Farewell!"
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: gathered so about him in the street that at the gate of the Priory he
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: had to turn about and speak to them; and he said:  "Good people,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: peace and quiet here."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: heard his word and rejoiced, and some of them ran off to tell King
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: him King Peter cried out: "There is no need to say a word, my son;
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: see, has e'en now come out to us."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Said Ralph:  "Father and mother, I pray your blessing, and also the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: blessing of the father Prior here; and the tale is short enough: that
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: we have overthrown them and slain the more part, and the others are now
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: being driven like a herd of swine into their stronghold of the Wood
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: older.  And in the doing of all this have but three of our men been
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: slain and a few hurt, amongst whom is thy son Hugh, but not sorely."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "O yea, son," said his mother, "he shall do well enough.  But now with
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: thy leave, holy Prior, we will depart, so that we may sleep in the High
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: House to-night, and feel that my dear son's hand is over us to ward us."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: son when they had kissed and embraced each other, and they wept for joy
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: early one day, and tell me all thy tale at full length."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: youngling."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

author: Morris, William

author: Morris, William

text: Then were the lights brought and the supper, and all men fell to feast,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and plenteous was the wine in the hall; and sure since first men met to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: eat together none have been merrier than they.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

text: But now when men had well eaten, and the great cup called the River of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Upmeads was brought in, the cupbearers, being so bidden before, brought
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: it last of all to King Peter, and he stood up with the River in his
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: hand and spoke aloud, and said: "Lords and warriors, and good people
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: all, here I do you to wit, that it is not because my son Ralph has come
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: home to-day and wrought us a great deliverance, and that my love hath
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: overcome me; it is not for this cause that I have set him in my throne
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: this even; but because I see and perceive that of all the kindred he is
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: meetest to sit therein so long as he liveth; unless perchance this
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: lovely and valiant woman should bear him a son even better than
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: himself--and so may it be.  Therefore I do you all to wit that this
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: man is the King of Upmeads, and this woman is his Lady and Queen; and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: so deem I of his prowess, and his wisdom, and kindliness, that I trow
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: he shall be lord and servant of other lands than Upmeads, and shall
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: draw the good towns and the kindreds and worthy good lords into peace
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and might and well-being, such as they have not known heretofore.  Now
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: within three days shall mass be sung in the choir of St. Laurence, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: then shall King Ralph swear on the gospels such oaths as ye wot of, to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: guard his people, and help the needy, and oppress no man, even as I
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: have sworn it.  And I say to you, that if I have kept the oath to my
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: power, yet shall he keep it better, as he is mightier than I.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "Furthermore, when he hath sworn, then shall the vassals swear to him
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: according to ancient custom, to be true to him and hardy in all due
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: service.  But so please you I will not abide till then, but will kneel
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: to him and to his Lady and Queen here and now."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Even so he did, and took Ralph's hand in his and swore service to him
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: such as was due; and he knelt to Ursula also, and bade her all thanks
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: for what she had done in the helping of his son; and they raised him up
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and made much of him and of Ralph's mother; and great was the joy of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: all folk in the hall.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: So the feast went on a while till the night grew old, and folk must
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: fare bedward.  Then King Peter and his wife brought Ralph and Ursula to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the chamber of the solar, the kingly chamber, which was well and goodly
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: dight with hangings and a fair and glorious bed, and was newly decked
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: with such fair flowers as the summer might furnish; and at the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: threshold King Peter stayed them and said: "Kinsman, and thou, dear
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: friend, this is become your due chamber and resting-place while ye live
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: in the world, and this night of all others it shall be a chamber of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: love; for ye are, as it were, new wedded, since now first ye are come
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: amongst the kindred as lover and beloved; and thou, Ursula, art now at
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: last the bride of this ancient house; now tell me, doth it not look
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: friendly and kindly on thee?"
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: "O yea, yea," she said.  "Come thou, my man and my darling and let us
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: be alone in the master-chamber of this ancient House."
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Then Ralph drew her unto him; and the old man blessed them and prayed
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: for goodly offspring for them, that the House of Upmeads might long
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: endure.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

text: kindred, as erst they lay alone in the desert.

text: Yet a Few Words Concerning Ralph of Upmeads
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale

text: Certain it is that Ralph failed not of his promise to the good Prior of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: St. Austin's at Wulstead, but went to see him speedily, and told him
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: all the tale of his wanderings as closely as he might, and hid naught
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: from him; which, as ye may wot, was more than one day's work or two or
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: three.  And ever when Ralph thus spoke was a brother of the House
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: sitting with the Prior, which brother was a learned and wise man and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: very speedy and deft with his pen.  Wherefore it has been deemed not
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: unlike that from this monk's writing has come the more part of the tale
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: above told.  And if it be so, it is well.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Furthermore, it is told of Ralph of Upmeads that he ruled over his
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: lands in right and might, and suffered no oppression within them, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: delivered other lands and good towns when they fell under tyrants and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: oppressors; and for as kind a man as he was in hall and at hearth, in
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the field he was a warrior so wise and dreadful, that oft forsooth the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: very sound of his name and rumour of his coming stayed the march of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: hosts and the ravage of fair lands; and no lord was ever more beloved.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Till his deathday he held the Castle of the Scaur, and cleansed the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Wood Perilous of all strong-thieves and reivers, so that no high-street
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: of a good town was safer than its glades and its byways.  The new folk
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: of the Burg of the Four Friths made him their lord and captain, and the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Champions of the Dry Tree obeyed him in all honour so long as any of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: them lasted.  He rode to Higham and offered himself as captain to the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: abbot thereof, and drave out the tyrants and oppressors thence, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: gave back peace to the Frank of Higham.  Ever was he true captain and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: brother to the Shepherd-folk, and in many battles they followed him;
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and were there any scarcity or ill hap amongst them, he helped them to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the uttermost of his power.  The Wood Debateable also he cleared of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: foul robbers and reivers, and rooted out the last of the Burg-devils,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and delivered three good towns beyond the wood from the cruelty of the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: oppressor.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Once in every year he and Ursula his wife visited the Land of
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Abundance, and he went into the castle there as into a holy place, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: worshipped the memory of the Lady whom he had loved so dearly.  With
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: all the friends of his quest he was kind and well-beloved.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: In about two years from the day when he rode home, came to him the Lord
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Bull of Utterbol with a chosen band, of whom were both Otter and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Redhead.  That very day they came he was about putting his foot in the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: stirrup to ride against the foemen; so Bull and his men would not go
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: into the High House to eat, but drank a cup where they stood, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: turned and rode with him straightway, and did him right manly service
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: in battle; and went back with him afterwards to Upmeads, and abode with
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: him there in feasting and joyance for two months' wearing.  And thrice
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: in the years that followed, when his lands at home seemed safest and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: most at peace, Ralph took a chosen band, and Ursula with them, and
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Clement withal, and journeyed through the wastes and the mountains to
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Utterbol, and passed joyous days with his old thrall of war, Bull Nosy,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: now become a very mighty man and the warder of the peace of the
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Uttermost lands.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: Clement and Katherine came oft to the High House, and Katherine
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: exceeding often; and she loved and cherished Ursula and lived long in
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: health of body and peace of mind.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: All the days that Ralph of Upmeads lived, he was the goodliest of men,
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: and no man to look on him had known it when he grew old; and when he
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: changed his life, an exceeding ancient man, he was to all men's eyes in
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: the very blossom of his age.
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: As to Ursula his wife, she was ever as valiant and true as when they
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: met in the dark night amidst of the Eastland wood.  Eight goodly
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: children she bore him, and saw four generations of her kindred wax up;
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: but even as it was with Ralph, never was she less goodly of body, nay
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: rather, but fairer than when first she came to Upmeads; and the day
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: whereon any man saw her was a day of joyful feast to him, a day to be
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: remembered for ever.  On one day they two died and were laid together
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
author: Morris, William

text: in one tomb in the choir of St. Laurence of Upmeads.  AND HERE ENDS THE
title: The Well at the World's End: A Tale
